title: Foreign Refugees Fleeing Ukraine Say They Were Held for Days at Border
sub_head: People from Africa, South Asia and the Middle East say they were pulled aside, as guards prioritized Ukrainians
body:
MEDYKA, Poland—Refugees from Africa, South Asia and the Middle East said border guards made them wait for days to leave Ukraine, outside in often snowy weather, before entering Poland, saying Ukraine’s overwhelmed immigration officers prioritized processing its own citizens.
As hundreds of thousands of people fled the Russian invasion of Ukraine for the European Union, guards began to accelerate their own nationals through lines where people waited for more than 48 hours, picking out Black, Asian or Middle Eastern refugees and holding them aside, said dozens of Ukrainians and foreigners who crossed the border.
